author: Special Correspondent
text:
Narikorava community women wait to submit a petition to the district administration on Monday seeking permission to put up stalls at the Bannari Amman Temple during its festival in Erode district., —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Members of Narikuravar Welfare Association on Monday submitted a petition to the Chief Minister through the district administration seeking permission for selling their bead garlands during the impending Kundam festival of Bannari Amman Temple.

The members, most of them members of women self-help groups belonging to Mettupalayam in Coimbatore district, said they were into the vocation, their only source of livelihood, utilising bank loans.

They had been enjoying the privilege of selling their bead garlands during the temple festival for the last 40 years, the petition said.
title: Narikurava women seek free stalls during Kundam festival
